titles.title: Gädlä Libanos “Vita of Libanos” / Täʾamrä Libanos “Miracles of Libanos” / Mälkәʾa Libanos “Image of Libanos”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Gädlä Libanos “Vita of Libanos” (fols. 1ra-44vb) II) Täʾamrä Libanos “Miracles of Libanos”: 11 miracles (fols. 45ra-54ra) III) Mälkәʾa Libanos “Image of Libanos”: 28 strophes (fols. 55ra-58ra).

copyists.copyist: Zä-Wäldä Gärima is mentioned as the scribe on fols. 43vb and 52vb (here he is mentioned as ʾabba Wäldä Gärima).

donors.donor: The names of Täsfa Mikaʾel and his wife Wälättä Ṣadǝqan are mentioned in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. (e.g., fols. 2rb, 8va, 14vb, 17ra).

txstates.txstate: The original sewing is damaged. The Ms. was crudely resewn with recent threads. Both wooden boards are broken and repaired; the textile material which covers them has been crudely repaired with synthetic threads. Many folios are affected by humidity: e.g., fols. 16r, 17r, 37r, 46r-59v. Holes roughly amended on fols. 2, 5, 56, 57, 59.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (both are broken and repaired) covered with the textile secondary cover. Two pairs of sewing stations.

inks.ink: Black; red (brilliant vermillion and vivid vermillion for the names in the supplication formulas)

squires.squire: The structure of most of the quires cannot be established with certainty due to the condition of the Ms.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Dispite the recent age, there are two ancient features: - the letter ጵ in the word ኢትዮጵያ has the 6th order marker set up on the vertical stroke at the top, oriented to the left (e.g. fols. 6va, 6vb, 11va, 12va) - the crux ansata with coronis on fol. 14v.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; name of the protagonist (both Libanos and Mäṭaˤ); in Text I, groups of lines on the incipit page of the prologue (fol. 3r) and on the incipit page of the proper account (fol. 17r), and the incipit of some subsections; in Text II, groups of lines on the incipit page, and incipit of each miracle; in Text III, groups of lines on the incipit page and the word sälam (and its abbreviation); elements of the punctuation signs, text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
- For the Gädlä Libanos, Täʾamrä Libanos and Mälkәʾa Libanos compare: A. BAUSI, La «Vita» e i «miracoli» di Libānos, Lovanii 2003 (CSCO 595, 596 [SAe 105, 106]). - Text I. Of this text, there are three different recensions (cp. Bausi 2003, XIII-XX): 1) GETATCHEW HAILE, “The Homily of Abba Elǝyas, Bishop of Aksum, on Mäṭṭa”, ABoll 108, 1990, 29-47. 2) ALESSANDRO BAUSI, La «Vita» e i «miracoli» di Libānos, Lovanii 2003a (CSCO 595, 596 [SAe 105, 106]), 1-72 [text] and 1-45 [tr.]. 3)CARLO CONTI ROSSINI, “Il Gadla Libânos”, in: Ricordi di un soggiorno in Eritrea. Fascicolo Primo, Asmara 1903, 25-34.
The text in MGM-012 seems more closed to the text as in the so called second recension, but with some more passages in the initial part. Certainly, it is needed a further and accurate investigation.
The text is attributed to ʾElyas, the Bishop of Aksum (mention on fol. 17ra).
The text contains, on fols. 1ra-vb, a rhymed prologue: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፨ በስመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ ዘአምቅድመ፡ ዓለም፡ ህላዌሁ፨ ወእስከ፡ ለዓለም፡ ዘኢየሐልቅ፡ ምስፍናሁ። ልዑል፡ በልዕልናሁ፨ ስብሕ፡ በስብሐቲሁ፨ ...
- Text II. The miracles are 11; with the exception of the miracle 1, all the others are wrongly numbered. All the miracles are also contained in Bausi 2003 (s. above); here we give the correspondence as follows [on the left, the miracles in Ms. MGM-012, with the indication of the folios containing them; on the right, the miracles in Bausi’s edition, with the specific number and the equivalent number of the verse (§) given in the edition]: Miracle 1 (fols. 46ra-46va) = Bausi, Miracle 2, §§ 203-204, 206-207 (without the additional passages found in Mss. AD = § 205) Miracle 2 [numbered as 3] (fols. 46va-47va) = Bausi, Miracle 3, §§ 208-211 Miracle 3 [numbered as 4] (fols. 47va-48rb) = Bausi, Miracle 4, §§ 212-214 Miracle 4 [numbered as 5] (fols. 48rb-48va) = Bausi, Miracle 5, §§ 215-216 Miracle 5 [numbered as 6] (fols. 48va-49va) = Bausi, Miracle 6, §§ 217-221 Miracle 6 [numbered as 7] (fols. 49va-50rb) = Bausi, Miracle 7, §§ 222-225 (without the additional passages found in Mss. AD = § 226) Miracle 7 [numbered as 8] (fols. 50rb-50va) = Bausi, Miracle 8, §§ 227-228 Miracle 8 [numbered as 9] (fols. 50va-51rb) = Bausi, Miracle 10, §§ 251-255 Miracle 9 [numbered as 10] (fols. 51rb-52ra) = Bausi, Miracle 32 (372-374; in MGM-012, after § 374 only few lines are added) Miracle 10 [numbered as 11] (fols. 52rb-52vb) = Bausi, Miracle 33, §§ 376-378 Miracle 11 [numbered as 12] (fols. 52vb-54ra) = Bausi, Miracle 11, §§ 256-261.
On fols. 45ra-46ra, the miracles are preceded by a praise in honour of the Saint (= Bausi, “Preambolo”, §§ 182-186).

extras.extra: - Omitted letters or words written interlineally: e.g., fols. 1ra, 6rb, 6vb, 14ra, 17rb, 19rb, 40ra, 50rb. - Spaces left unfilled in the supplication formulas on fol. 48va. - Crude notes on the textile covering the front board, on the bottom margin of fols. 4r, 24r, 33v, 36r and on fols. 54rb, 54v, 58rb, 58v-59v. - Pen trial on the right margin of fol. 35r.

frames.frame: Fol. 1r (incipit page of Text I): crude, coloured (red and black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. Fol. 17r (incipit page of the account proper in Text I): crude, coloured (red and black) ornamental band; geometric motifs.
